Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: The Cleansing Quality of Water
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى وَغَيْرُهُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ اللُّؤْلُؤِيِّ بِإِسْنَادِهِ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) الْمَاءُ كُلُّهُ طَاهِرٌ حَتَّى يُعْلَمَ أَنَّهُ قَذِرٌ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya and others have narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad from al-Hassan ibn al-Hassan al-Lu’lu’i through his chain of narrators has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘All water is clean until it is found out that it is not clean.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/5)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: The Cleansing Quality of Water
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ أَبِي دَاوُدَ الْمُنْشِدِ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ الْمَاءُ كُلُّهُ طَاهِرٌ حَتَّى يُعْلَمَ أَنَّهُ قَذِرٌ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Hassan from abu Dawud al-Munshid from Ja’far ibn Muhammad from Yunus from Hammad ibn ‘Uthman who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, that all water (from source) is clean until it is found out that it is not clean.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/6)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #8.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: The Quantity of Water that Always Remains Clean
Hadith #8.arabicText: 8ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ الْكُرُّ مِنَ الْمَاءِ نَحْوُ حُبِّي هَذَا وَأَشَارَ بِيَدِهِ إِلَى حُبٍّ مِنْ تِلْكَ الْحِبَابِ الَّتِي تَكُونُ بِالْمَدِينَةِ.
Hadith #8.englishText: 8. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ’Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from certain persons of our people who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘The quantity of one Kur of water is of the size of this Hubb (a water container).’ He pointed with his hand to one of those Hubb which are used in al- Madinah.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/16)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: The Case of a Small Quantity of Water, the Water with a Dead Body in it and its use by a Man to Wash His Dirty Hand in it
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَمُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ جَمِيعاً عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) أَنَّهُ قَالَ كُلَّمَا غَلَبَ الْمَاءُ رِيحَ الْجِيفَةِ فَتَوَضَّأْ مِنَ الْمَاءِ وَاشْرَبْ وَإِذَا تَغَيَّرَ الْمَاءُ وَتَغَيَّرَ الطَّعْمُ فَلاَ تَتَوَضَّأْ وَلاَ تَشْرَبْ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father and Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from Hammad from Hariz from those who reported to him who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said that as long as water overwhelms the smell of a dead animal you can take Wudu’ with it and drink it, but when the smell changes as well as its taste, then do not take Wudu’ with it and do not drink it.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/19)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #9.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: The Case of a Well and Things that May Fall in It (Fatwa best explains Ahadith 2-12 as well as the following chapter.)
Hadith #9.arabicText: 9ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ قُلْتُ بِئْرٌ يُخْرَجُ فِي مَائِهَا قِطَعُ جُلُودٍ قَالَ لَيْسَ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ إِنَّ الْوَزَغَ رُبَّمَا طَرَحَ جِلْدَهُ وَقَالَ يَكْفِيكَ دَلْوٌ مِنْ مَاءٍ.
Hadith #9.englishText: 9. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from ’Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from those whom he has mentioned who have said the following: “I once said to abu ’Abd Allah , that there is a water-well and with its water pieces of skin come out. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not anything. Perhaps a frog sheds its skin.’ He (the Imam) said that one bucket of water is sufficient for you.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/29)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: A Well near a Cesspool
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ أَبِي إِسْمَاعِيلَ السَّرَّاجِ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ قُدَامَةَ بْنِ أَبِي يَزِيدَ الْحَمَّارِ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ كَمْ أَدْنَى مَا يَكُونُ بَيْنَ الْبِئْرِ بِئْرِ الْمَاءِ وَالْبَالُوعَةِ فَقَالَ إِنْ كَانَ سَهْلاً فَسَبْعَةُ أَذْرُعٍ وَإِنْ كَانَ جَبَلاً فَخَمْسَةُ أَذْرُعٍ ثُمَّ قَالَ الْمَاءُ يَجْرِي إِلَى الْقِبْلَةِ إِلَى يَمِينٍ وَيَجْرِي عَنْ يَمِينِ الْقِبْلَةِ إِلَى يَسَارِ الْقِبْلَةِ وَيَجْرِي عَنْ يَسَارِ الْقِبْلَةِ إِلَى يَمِينِ الْقِبْلَةِ وَلاَ يَجْرِي مِنَ الْقِبْلَةِ إِلَى دُبُرِ الْقِبْلَةِ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il from abu ’Isma‘il from al-Sarraj from ‘Abd Allah ibn ‘Uthman from Qudamah ibn abu Yazid al-Hammar from certain persons of our people who have said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about the distance needed between a well and a cesspool. He (the Imam) replied, ‘If the ground is plain, the distance must be seven yards; and if it is a hillside the distance must be five yards.’ He (the Imam) then said, ‘Water flows forward in direction, to the right or to the left or from its left side to its right side (in) forward direction but it does not flow backward.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/34)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #7.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Taking Wudu’ With Water from Which Animals, Beasts and Birds Have Drunk
Hadith #7.arabicText: 7ـ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَيُّوبَ بْنِ نُوحٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَكْرَهُ سُؤْرَ كُلِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ لاَ يُؤْكَلُ لَحْمُهُ.
Hadith #7.englishText: 7. Ahmad ibn Idris has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad from Ayyub ibn Nuh from al-Washsha’ from those whom he has mentioned who have said the following: “Abu ’Abd Allah , disliked using the leftover of the water from which inedible animals have drunk.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/38)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #6.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Taking Wudu’ with the Water from Which a Woman during Her Hayd (menses), People After Having Carnal Relations, a Jew, a Christian or a Person Hostile toward ’A’immah Has Drunk (Fatwa best explains Ahadith 4-6 of this chapter.)
Hadith #6.arabicText: 6ـ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَيُّوبَ بْنِ نُوحٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) أَنَّهُ كَرِهَ سُؤْرَ وَلَدِ الزِّنَا وَسُؤْرَ الْيَهُودِيِّ وَالنَّصْرَانِيِّ وَالْمُشْرِكِ وَكُلِّ مَا خَالَفَ الإِسْلاَمَ وَكَانَ أَشَدَّ ذَلِكَ عِنْدَهُ سُؤْرُ النَّاصِبِ.
Hadith #6.englishText: 6. Ahmad ibn Idris has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad from Ayyub ibn Nuh from al-Washsha’ from those whom he has mentioned who have said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , did not like the leftover of a person born out of wedlock, Jews, Christians and pagans and whoever opposed Islam and most serious to him was the leftover of one hostile to ’A’immah, ‘Alayhim al-Salam.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/40)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Mixing of Rain Water with Urine, with Water Used for Taking Ghusl (bath) Because of Carnal Relations, Touching of One’s Cloth with Water Used for Washing Because of Urine
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْهَيْثَمِ بْنِ أَبِي مَسْرُوقٍ عَنِ الْحَكَمِ بْنِ مِسْكِينٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَرْوَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ لَوْ أَنَّ مِيزَابَيْنِ سَالاَ أَحَدُهُمَا مِيزَابُ بَوْلٍ وَالآخَرُ مِيزَابُ مَاءٍ فَاخْتَلَطَا ثُمَّ أَصَابَكَ مَا كَانَ بِهِ بَأْسٌ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Haytham ibn abu Masruq from al-Hakam ibn Miskin from Muhammad ibn Marwan who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said that if two drain-shoots, one with rain water and the other with urine mix, and drops thereof sprinkle over one’s clothes, it is not harmful for him.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/43)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Mixing of Rain Water with Urine, with Water Used for Taking Ghusl (bath) Because of Carnal Relations, Touching of One’s Cloth with Water Used for Washing Because of Urine
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنِ الْكَاهِلِيِّ عَنْ رَجُلٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ قُلْتُ أَمُرُّ فِي الطَّرِيقِ فَيَسِيلُ عَلَيَّ الْمِيزَابُ فِي أَوْقَاتٍ أَعْلَمُ أَنَّ النَّاسَ يَتَوَضَّئُونَ قَالَ قَالَ لَيْسَ بِهِ بَأْسٌ لاَ تَسْأَلْ عَنْهُ قُلْتُ وَيَسِيلُ عَلَيَّ مِنْ مَاءِ الْمَطَرِ أَرَى فِيهِ التَّغَيُّرَ وَأَرَى فِيهِ آثَارَ الْقَذَرِ فَتَقْطُرُ الْقَطَرَاتُ عَلَيَّ وَيَنْتَضِحُ عَلَيَّ مِنْهُ وَالْبَيْتُ يُتَوَضَّأُ عَلَى سَطْحِهِ فَيَكِفُ عَلَى ثِيَابِنَا قَالَ مَا بِذَا بَأْسٌ لاَ تَغْسِلْهُ كُلُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ يَرَاهُ مَاءُ الْمَطَرِ فَقَدْ طَهُرَ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Ahmad ibn Muhammad from has narrated from Ali ibn al-Hakam from al-Kahiliy from a man who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , ‘I sometimes, pass by and water from a drain-shoot falls on me. At such time, I know, people take Wudu’. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful. You do not need to ask (inquire).’ I (the narrator) then asked, ‘What happens if rain water falls on me and I see its color is changed; there are signs of dirt with it and several drops sprinkle and fall on me, while on the roof of the house people take Wudu’. Should we keep our clothes on us in such condition?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful. You do not need to wash your clothes. Everything and substance which has become unclean turns clean when rain falls on it.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/43)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Mixing of Rain Water with Urine, with Water Used for Taking Ghusl (bath) Because of Carnal Relations, Touching of One’s Cloth with Water Used for Washing Because of Urine
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ فِي طِينِ الْمَطَرِ أَنَّهُ لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ أَنْ يُصِيبَ الثَّوْبَ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ إِلاَّ أَنْ يُعْلَمَ أَنَّهُ قَدْ نَجَّسَهُ شَيْ‏ءٌ بَعْدَ الْمَطَرِ فَإِنْ أَصَابَهُ بَعْدَ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ فَاغْسِلْهُ وَإِنْ كَانَ الطَّرِيقُ نَظِيفاً لَمْ تَغْسِلْهُ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il from certain persons of our people who have said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan , about soil which is found with rain water. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful up to three days unless it is found out to have become Najis (unclean) by something after rainfall. If such drops sprinkle after three days, then you must wash, but if the road is clean, then you do not need to wash.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/44)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Water of Bath Houses and Water Heated by the Sun’s Rays
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ حَازِمٍ عَنْ بَكْرِ بْنِ حَبِيبٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ مَاءُ الْحَمَّامِ لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ إِذَا كَانَتْ لَهُ مَادَّةٌ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from Safwan ibn Yahya from Mansur ibn Hazim from Bakr ibn Habib who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far , has said, ‘Water of bathhouses does not have problems if it is water from a large source; like a fountain.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/46)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Water of Bath Houses and Water Heated by the Sun’s Rays
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِي يَحْيَى الْوَاسِطِيِّ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الْمَاضِي (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سُئِلَ عَنْ مَجْمَعِ الْمَاءِ فِي الْحَمَّامِ مِنْ غُسَالَةِ النَّاسِ يُصِيبُ الثَّوْبَ قَالَ لاَ بَأْسَ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from abu Yahya al-Wasitiy from certain persons of our people who have said the following: “Abu al-Hassan, the one before , was asked about accumulated water in bathhouses used by people which pollutes clothes. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/49)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #6.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Places Not Desirable to Use as a Lavatory
Hadith #6.arabicText: 6ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ عُقْبَةَ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْكَرْخِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) ثَلاَثُ خِصَالٍ مَلْعُونٌ مَنْ فَعَلَهُنَّ الْمُتَغَوِّطُ فِي ظِلِّ النُّزَّالِ وَالْمَانِعُ الْمَاءَ الْمُنْتَابَ وَسَادُّ الطَّرِيقِ الْمَسْلُوكِ.
Hadith #6.englishText: 6. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il from Salih ibn ‘Uqbah from Ibrahim al-Karkhiy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said that the Messenger of Allah has said, ‘Three characteristics subject one to condemnation: Defecating in the shadows which are used as rest areas, obstructing people from reaching water for public use or public road.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/52)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Expressions to Say When Entering a Lavatory and When Coming Out
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ نَهَى رَسُولُ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) أَنْ يَسْتَنْجِيَ الرَّجُلُ بِيَمِينِهِ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus from certain persons of our people who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said that the Holy Prophet prohibited using one’s right hand to wash one’s buttocks and urethra.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/55)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #16.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Expressions to Say When Entering a Lavatory and When Coming Out
Hadith #16.arabicText: 16ـ عَنْهُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَبُولُ وَيَنْسَى أَنْ يَغْسِلَ ذَكَرَهُ حَتَّى يَتَوَضَّأَ وَيُصَلِّيَ قَالَ يَغْسِلُ ذَكَرَهُ وَيُعِيدُ الصَّلاَةَ وَلاَ يُعِيدُ الْوُضُوءَ.
Hadith #16.englishText: 16. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus from Zur’ah, from Sama‘ah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘After using toilet if you forget to wash clean your buttocks (because of feces) and take Wudu’, then remember after performing Salah (prayer), you must perform your Salah (prayer) again. If you wash your buttocks clean but forget washing your urethra clean and perform Salah (prayer), you must take Wudu’, wash your urethra and perform your Salah (prayer) again. It is because urine is not like feces.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/60)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #6.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Draining Urine, Washing and If One Does Not Find Water
Hadith #6.arabicText: 6ـ الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ عَنْ سَعْدَانَ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ قَالَ كَتَبْتُ إِلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فِي خَصِيٍّ يَبُولُ فَيَلْقَى مِنْ ذَلِكَ شِدَّةً وَيَرَى الْبَلَلَ بَعْدَ الْبَلَلِ قَالَ يَتَوَضَّأُ ثُمَّ يَنْتَضِحُ فِي النَّهَارِ مَرَّةً وَاحِدَةً.
Hadith #6.englishText: 6. Al-Husayn from Muhammad has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ahmad ibn Ishaq from Sa‘dan from ‘Abd al-Rahman who has said the following: “I once wrote to abu al-Hassan , about a castrated man who when urinating feels great pain and finds wetness time after time. He (the Imam) said, ‘He must take Wudu 5 and pour water on it once during the day.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/64)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Brushing One’s Teeth
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ سَهْلٍ وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ جَمِيعاً عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الأشْعَرِيِّ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ الْقَدَّاحِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ رَكْعَتَانِ بِالسِّوَاكِ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ سَبْعِينَ رَكْعَةً بِغَيْرِ سِوَاكٍ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) لَوْ لاَ أَنْ أَشُقَّ عَلَى أُمَّتِي لأَمَرْتُهُمْ بِالسِّوَاكِ مَعَ كُلِّ صَلاَةٍ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Muhammad has narrated from Sahl and Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father all from Ja‘far ibn Muhammad al- Ash’ariy from ’Abd Allah ibn Maymun from al-Qaddah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘Performing two Rak‘at Salah (prayer) with one’s teeth brushed is better than seventy Rak‘at without one’s teeth brushed. The Messenger of Allah has said, ‘Were it not to cause hardships to my followers, I would command them to brush their teeth for every Salah (prayer).”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/69)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Brushing One’s Teeth
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فِي السِّوَاكِ قَالَ لاَ تَدَعْهُ فِي كُلِّ ثَلاَثٍ وَلَوْ أَنْ تُمِرَّهُ مَرَّةً.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from ibn Bukayr from those whom he has mentioned has said the following: “Abu Ja’far , has said, ‘You must not neglect brushing after every third (Salah (prayer)) even though it is a light one (brushing).”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/70)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Brushing One’s Teeth
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ عَلِيٌّ بِإِسْنَادِهِ قَالَ أَدْنَى السِّوَاكِ أَنْ تَدْلُكَ بِإِصْبَعِكَ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Ali through his chain of narrators has narrated the following: “He (the Imam) , has said, ‘The least for brushing is using one’s fingers as a tooth brush.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/0)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Rinsing One’s Mouth and Nostrils
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ شَاذَانَ بْنِ الْخَلِيلِ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الْمَضْمَضَةِ وَالاسْتِنْشَاقِ قَالَ لَيْسَ هُمَا مِنَ الْوُضُوءِ هُمَا مِنَ الْجَوْفِ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Shadhan ibn al-Khalil from Yunus ibn ‘Abd al- Rahman from Hammad from abu Basir who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about rinsing one’s mouth and nostrils. He (the Imam) said, ‘They are not part of Wudu’.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/72)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #7.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Wudu’
Hadith #7.arabicText: 7ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَأَبِي دَاوُدَ جَمِيعاً عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ فَضَالَةَ بْنِ أَيُّوبَ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ مَيْسَرَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ الْوُضُوءُ وَاحِدَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ وَوَصَفَ الْكَعْبَ فِي ظَهْرِ الْقَدَمِ.
Hadith #7.englishText: 7. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad and abu Dawud all from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from Fadalah ibn Ayyub from Hammad ibn ‘Uthaman from Ali ibn al-Mughirah from Maysarah who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far , has said, ‘Wudu’ is one (washing of the face and hands) and one (wiping of the head and feet).’ He (the Imam) then explained about the ankle in the back of the foot.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/78)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #6.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: The Area of the Face and Hands to be Washed for Wudu’
Hadith #6.arabicText: 6ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَخِيهِ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ بَزِيعٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ فَرَضَ الله عَلَى النِّسَاءِ فِي الْوُضُوءِ لِلصَّلاَةِ أَنْ يَبْتَدِئْنَ بِبَاطِنِ أَذْرُعِهِنَّ وَفِي الرِّجَالِ بِظَاهِرِ الذِّرَاعِ.
Hadith #6.englishText: 6. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his brother Ishaq ibn Ibrahim from Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il ibn Bazi‘ who has said the following: “Abu al-Hassan, al-Rida , has said, ‘In the case of women about Wudu’ for Salah (prayer), Allah has made it obligatory in washing their hands to pour water over the interior side of their forearm and for men to pour water over the exterior side of their forearms.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/93)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Wiping of Head and Feet
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ شَاذَانَ بْنِ الْخَلِيلِ النَّيْسَابُورِيِّ عَنْ مَعْمَرِ بْنِ عُمَرَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ يُجْزِئُ مِنَ الْمَسْحِ عَلَى الرَّأْسِ مَوْضِعُ ثَلاَثِ أَصَابِعَ وَكَذَلِكَ الرِّجْلُ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Shadhan ibn Khalil al-Naysaburiy from Mu’ammar ibn ‘Umar who has said the following: “Abu Ja’far , has said, ’For wiping the head it is sufficient to wipe a portion of it the size of three fingers and so also is the case of the feet.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/95)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Wiping of Head and Feet
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ شَاذَانَ بْنِ الْخَلِيلِ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) رَجُلٌ تَوَضَّأَ وَهُوَ مُعْتَمٌّ فَثَقُلَ عَلَيْهِ نَزْعُ الْعِمَامَةِ لِمَكَانِ الْبَرْدِ فَقَالَ لِيُدْخِلْ إِصْبَعَهُ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Shadhan ibn al-Khalil, from Yunus, from Hammad, from Al- Husayn who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about a man who wears a turban and it is difficult for him to remove it because of the cold. He (the Imam) said, ‘He can push his finger under the turban.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/96)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #7.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Wiping of Head and Feet
Hadith #7.arabicText: 7ـ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ قَالَ أَخْبَرَنِي مَنْ رَأَى أَبَا الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) بِمِنًى يَمْسَحُ ظَهْرَ قَدَمَيْهِ مِنْ أَعْلَى الْقَدَمِ إِلَى الْكَعْبِ وَمِنَ الْكَعْبِ إِلَى أَعْلَى الْقَدَمِ وَيَقُولُ الأمْرُ فِي مَسْحِ الرِّجْلَيْنِ مُوَسَّعٌ مَنْ شَاءَ مَسَحَ مُقْبِلاً وَمَنْ شَاءَ مَسَحَ مُدْبِراً فَإِنَّهُ مِنَ الأمْرِ الْمُوَسَّعِ إِنْ شَاءَ الله.
Hadith #7.englishText: 7. Ahmad ibn Idris has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus who has said the following: “One who had seen abu al-Hassan , in Mina narrated to me that he (the Imam) wiped over his feet to the ankles and from the ankles toward the backs of his feet and said that the matter about wiping the feet is simple. One may wipe forward or backward; it is one of the matters in which ease is granted by the will of Allah.’” (Fatwa best explains this Hadith.)

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/103)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #9.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Wiping of Head and Feet
Hadith #9.arabicText: 9ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنِ الْحَكَمِ بْنِ مِسْكِينٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَرْوَانَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) إِنَّهُ يَأْتِي عَلَى الرَّجُلِ سِتُّونَ وَسَبْعُونَ سَنَةً مَا قَبِلَ الله مِنْهُ صَلاَةً قُلْتُ وَكَيْفَ ذَاكَ قَالَ لأَنَّهُ يَغْسِلُ مَا أَمَرَ الله بِمَسْحِهِ.
Hadith #9.englishText: 9. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from al-Hakam ibn Miskin from Muhammad ibn Marwan who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘One may live for sixty or seventy years while Allah has not accepted not even one of his Salah (prayer).’ I (the narrator) then asked, ‘How can that happen?’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/105)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #8.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Facing Doubts about Wudu’ Forgetting or Mixing Proper Order
Hadith #8.arabicText: 8ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ السِّنْدِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) رُبَّمَا تَوَضَّأْتُ فَنَفِدَ الْمَاءُ فَدَعَوْتُ الْجَارِيَةَ فَأَبْطَأَتْ عَلَيَّ بِالْمَاءِ فَيَجِفُّ وَضُوئِي فَقَالَ أَعِدْ.
Hadith #8.englishText: 8. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Salih ibn al-Sindiy from Ja‘far ibn Bashir from Muhammad ibn abu Hamzah from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “I once said to abu ‘Abd Allah , ‘I may sometimes begin to take Wudu’ but water is finished before Wudu’ is complete and I ask the slave-girl for more water; but she delays and my Wudu’ dries up. He (the Imam) said, ‘You must do your Wudu’ again.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/114)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Matters that Invalidate or Do not Invalidate Wudu’
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ ظَرِيفٍ عَنْ ثَعْلَبَةَ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ يَزِيدَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ لَيْسَ فِي حَبِّ الْقَرْعِ وَالدِّيدَانَ الصِّغَارِ وُضُوءٌ إِنَّمَا هُوَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ الْقَمْلِ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il from Zarif from Tha’labah ibn Maymun from ‘Abd Allah ibn Yazid who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘It is not necessary to take Wudu’ because of the coming out of one’s buttock, such things as pumpkin seeds or small worms; they are like lice.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/116)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Matters that Invalidate or Do not Invalidate Wudu’
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ أَخِي فُضَيْلٍ عَنْ فُضَيْلٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُ مِثْلُ حَبِّ الْقَرْعِ قَالَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ وُضُوءٌ. وَرُوِيَ إِذَا كَانَتْ مُلَطَّخَةً بِالْعَذِرَةِ أَعَادَ الْوُضُوءَ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from al-Hassan ibn Akhiy Fudayl from Fudayl who has said the following: “It is about the case of a man from whose buttocks such things like pumpkin seed may come out. Abu ‘Abd Allah , once said, ‘It is not necessary for him to take Wudu’.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/116)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #16.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Matters that Invalidate or Do not Invalidate Wudu’
Hadith #16.arabicText: 16ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ جُمْهُورٍ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ سَعْدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ أُذُنَانِ وَعَيْنَانِ تَنَامُ الْعَيْنَانِ وَلاَ تَنَامُ الأذُنَانِ وَذَلِكَ لاَ يَنْقُضُ الْوُضُوءَ فَإِذَا نَامَتِ الْعَيْنَانِ وَالأذُنَانِ انْتَقَضَ الْوُضُوءُ.
Hadith #16.englishText: 16. Ali ibn Muhammad has narrated from ibn Jumhur from those whom he has mentioned from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Sa‘d who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘There are ears and eyes. Eyes may sleep but not yet the ears. This does not invalidate Wudu’. When both eyes and ears sleep, Wudu’ becomes invalid.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/120)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One’s Stepping over Feces or Other Such Things
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدٍ الْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ نَزَلْنَا فِي مَكَانٍ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ الْمَسْجِدِ زُقَاقٌ قَذَرٌ فَدَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فَقَالَ أَيْنَ نَزَلْتُمْ فَقُلْتُ نَزَلْنَا فِي دَارِ فُلاَنٍ فَقَالَ إِنَّ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَ الْمَسْجِدِ زُقَاقاً قَذَراً أَوْ قُلْنَا لَهُ إِنَّ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ الْمَسْجِدِ زُقَاقاً قَذَراً فَقَالَ لاَ بَأْسَ الأرْضُ تُطَهِّرُ بَعْضُهَا بَعْضاً قُلْتُ وَالسِّرْقِينُ الرَّطْبُ أَطَأُ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالَ لاَ يَضُرُّكَ مِثْلُهُ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from Safwan from Ishaq ibn ‘Ammar from Muhammad al-Halabiy who has said the following: “Once we found lodging in a place. Between this place and the Masjid there were dirty passageways. I visited abu ‘Abd Allah . He (the Imam) asked, ‘Where have you found lodging?’ I replied, ‘It is the house of so and so.’ He (the Imam) or we said, ‘Between that house and Masjid there are unclean passageways.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful, certain parts of earth cleanse other parts.’ I (the narrator) asked, ‘What happens if I step on wet dung?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘Such things are not harmful.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/122)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Necessity of Ghusl (bath) on Friday
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ وَمُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الله قَالَ سَأَلْتُ الرِّضَا (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنْ غُسْلِ يَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ فَقَالَ وَاجِبٌ عَلَى كُلِّ ذَكَرٍ وَأُنْثَى عَبْدٍ أَوْ حُرٍّ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ali ibn Muhammad has narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad and Muhammad ibn Yahya from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn abu Nasr from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd Allah who has said the following: “I once asked al-Rida’ , about Ghusl (bath) on Friday. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is obligatory on every male, female, slave or free.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/129)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #6.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Necessity of Ghusl (bath) on Friday
Hadith #6.arabicText: 6ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ مُوسَى عَنْ أُمِّهِ وَأُمِّ أَحْمَدَ بِنْتِ مُوسَى قَالَتَا كُنَّا مَعَ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) بِالْبَادِيَةِ وَنَحْنُ نُرِيدُ بَغْدَادَ فَقَالَ لَنَا يَوْمَ الْخَمِيسِ اغْتَسِلاَ الْيَوْمَ لِغَدٍ يَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ فَإِنَّ الْمَاءَ بِهَا غَداً قَلِيلٌ فَاغْتَسَلْنَا يَوْمَ الْخَمِيسِ لِيَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ.
Hadith #6.englishText: 6. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Husayn ibn Musa from his mother, mother of Ahmad daughter of Musa who have said the following: “We were with abu al-Hassan , in the desert on our way to Baghdad. He (the Imam) said to us, ‘Today is Thursday, take Ghusl (bath) for Friday, tomorrow water will be scarce.’ We took Ghusl (bath) on Thursday for Friday.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/130)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #7.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Necessity of Ghusl (bath) on Friday
Hadith #7.arabicText: 7ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ لاَ بُدَّ مِنْ غُسْلِ يَوْمِ الْجُمُعَةِ فِي السَّفَرِ وَالْحَضَرِ فَمَنْ نَسِيَ فَلْيُعِدْ مِنَ الْغَدِ وَرُوِيَ فِيهِ رُخْصَةٌ لِلْعَلِيلِ.
Hadith #7.englishText: 7. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Hammad from Hariz from certain persons of our people who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far , has said, ‘It is necessary to take Ghusl (bath) on Friday, on a journey or at home. If one forgets it, one must do it again next day.’ It is narrated that one suffering from illness is excused.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/130)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Ghusl (bath), Wudu’ Before or Thereafter and a Man’s Ghusl (bath) in an Improper Place, Expressions to Say During Taking Ghusl (bath) and Moving a Ring During Ghusl (bath)
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا قَالَ قَالَ تَقُولُ فِي غُسْلِ الْجُمُعَةِ اللهمَّ طَهِّرْ قَلْبِي مِنْ كُلِّ آفَةٍ تَمْحَقُ بِهَا دِينِي وَتُبْطِلُ بِهَا عَمَلِي وَتَقُولُ فِي غُسْلِ الْجَنَابَةِ اللهمَّ طَهِّرْ قَلْبِي وَزَكِّ عَمَلِي وَتَقَبَّلْ سَعْيِي وَاجْعَلْ مَا عِنْدَكَ خَيْراً لِي.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from certain persons of our people who has said the following: “He (the Imam) has said, ‘When taking Ghusl (bath) for Friday, you should say the following: “O Lord, cleanse my heart of all afflictions which destroy my religion and invalidate my deeds.” “When taking Ghusl (bath) because of sexual relation say the following: ‘O Lord, cleanse my heart, purify my deeds, accept my efforts and make what is with You for me to be good.’””

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/133)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #7.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Ghusl (bath), Wudu’ Before or Thereafter and a Man’s Ghusl (bath) in an Improper Place, Expressions to Say During Taking Ghusl (bath) and Moving a Ring During Ghusl (bath)
Hadith #7.arabicText: 7ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى وَأَبُو دَاوُدَ جَمِيعاً عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فِي رَجُلٍ أَصَابَتْهُ جَنَابَةٌ فَقَامَ فِي الْمَطَرِ حَتَّى سَالَ عَلَى جَسَدِهِ أَ يُجْزِئُهُ ذَلِكَ مِنَ الْغُسْلِ قَالَ نَعَمْ.
Hadith #7.englishText: 7. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa and abu Dawud all from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from Muhammad ibn abu Hamzah from a man who has said the following: “I once asked abu ’Abd Allah , about a man who has had sexual relation after which he stands in the rain until water flows over his body. ‘Is this sufficient for Ghusl (bath)? He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, it is sufficient.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/134)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #10.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Ghusl (bath), Wudu’ Before or Thereafter and a Man’s Ghusl (bath) in an Improper Place, Expressions to Say During Taking Ghusl (bath) and Moving a Ring During Ghusl (bath)
Hadith #10.arabicText: 10ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ بَكْرِ بْنِ كَرِبٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَغْتَسِلُ مِنَ الْجَنَابَةِ أَ يَغْسِلُ رِجْلَيْهِ بَعْدَ الْغُسْلِ فَقَالَ إِنْ كَانَ يَغْتَسِلُ فِي مَكَانٍ يَسِيلُ الْمَاءُ عَلَى رِجْلَيْهِ بَعْدَ الْغُسْلِ فَلاَ عَلَيْهِ أَنْ لاَ يَغْسِلَهُمَا وَإِنْ كَانَ يَغْتَسِلُ فِي مَكَانٍ يَسْتَنْقِعُ رِجْلاَهُ فِي الْمَاءِ فَلْيَغْسِلْهُمَا.
Hadith #10.englishText: 10. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Hammad from Bakr ibn Karib who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about a man who takes Ghusl (bath) because of sexual relation; must he wash his feet after Ghusl (bath)? He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not necessary for him to wash if he stands during taking Ghusl (bath) at such a place where water flows over his feet, but he must wash them if, while taking Ghusl (bath) he stands in a place where his feet are in stagnant water.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/136)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #12.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Ghusl (bath), Wudu’ Before or Thereafter and a Man’s Ghusl (bath) in an Improper Place, Expressions to Say During Taking Ghusl (bath) and Moving a Ring During Ghusl (bath)
Hadith #12.arabicText: 12ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ شَاذَانَ بْنِ الْخَلِيلِ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ طَلْحَةَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) يَقُولُ الْوُضُوءُ بَعْدَ الْغُسْلِ بِدْعَةٌ.
Hadith #12.englishText: 12. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Shadhan ibn al-Khalil from Yunus from Yahya ibn Talhah from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sulayman who has said the following: “I heard abu ‘Abd Allah , say, ‘Wudu’ after Ghusl (bath) is heresy.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/137)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #16.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Ghusl (bath), Wudu’ Before or Thereafter and a Man’s Ghusl (bath) in an Improper Place, Expressions to Say During Taking Ghusl (bath) and Moving a Ring During Ghusl (bath)
Hadith #16.arabicText: 16ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدٍ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ لاَ تَنْقُضُ الْمَرْأَةُ شَعْرَهَا إِذَا اغْتَسَلَتْ مِنَ الْجَنَابَةِ.
Hadith #16.englishText: 16. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from ibn Muskan from Muhammad al-Halabiy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘It is not necessary for a woman to open up her hairs when taking Ghusl (bath) because of sexual relation.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/139)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #7.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Reason Necessitating Ghusl (bath) for Men and Women
Hadith #7.arabicText: 7ـ الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ عَامِرٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مَهْزِيَارَ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْفُضَيْلِ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الْمَرْأَةِ تُعَانِقُ زَوْجَهَا مِنْ خَلْفِهِ فَتَحَرَّكُ عَلَى ظَهْرِهِ فَتَأْتِيهَا الشَّهْوَةُ فَتُنْزِلُ الْمَاءَ عَلَيْهَا الْغُسْلُ أَوْ لاَ يَجِبُ عَلَيْهَا الْغُسْلُ قَالَ إِذَا جَاءَتْهَا الشَّهْوَةُ فَأَنْزَلَتِ الْمَاءَ وَجَبَ عَلَيْهِ الْغُسْلُ.
Hadith #7.englishText: 7. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from ‘Abd Allah ibn ‘Amir from Ali ibn Mahziyar from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from Muhammad ibn al-Fudayl who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan , about the case of a woman who hugs her husband from his backside. She moves and experiences orgasm and discharge, is Ghusl (bath) necessary on her? He (the Imam) said, ‘If she experiences orgasm and discharge, Ghusl (bath) becomes necessary.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/142)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One after Carnal Relation Sweats in His Clothes, Clothes Touch His Wet Body
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمْزَةَ بْنِ حُمْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ لاَ يُجْنِبُ الثَّوْبُ الرَّجُلَ وَلاَ يُجْنِبُ الرَّجُلُ الثَّوْبَ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Faddal from ibn Bukayr from Hamzah ibn Humran who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘Clothes do not cause one to become as one who has experienced sexual relation and one experiencing sexual relation does not affect his clothes.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/153)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #7.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine Comes in Contact with One’s Clothes or Body
Hadith #7.arabicText: 7ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ غَزْوَانَ عَنِ الْحَكَمِ بْنِ الْحُكَيْمِ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) إِنِّي أَغْدُو إِلَى السُّوقِ فَأَحْتَاجُ إِلَى الْبَوْلِ وَلَيْسَ عِنْدِي مَاءٌ ثُمَّ أَتَمَسَّحُ وَأَتَنَشَّفُ بِيَدِي ثُمَّ أَمْسَحُهَا بِالْحَائِطِ وَبِالأرْضِ ثُمَّ أَحُكُّ جَسَدِي بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ قَالَ لاَ بَأْسَ.
Hadith #7.englishText: 7. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from al-Fadl ibn Ghazwan from al- Hakam ibn Hukaym who has said the following: “I once said to abu ‘Abd Allah , ‘I may go to market place and need to urinate but do not find water. I then wipe it dry, then wipe my hand against the wall or ground, and scratch with it my body afterwards. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/159)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine of Animals and Their Dung
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ عَنْ بُكَيْرِ بْنِ أَعْيَنَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا (عَلَيْهِما الْسَّلام) فِي أَبْوَالِ الدَّوَابِّ تُصِيبُ الثَّوْبَ فَكَرِهَهُ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ أَ لَيْسَ لُحُومُهَا حَلاَلاً قَالَ بَلَى وَلَكِنْ لَيْسَ مِمَّا جَعَلَهُ الله لِلأكْلِ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn Khalid from al-Qasim ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Urwah from Bukayr ibn ’A‘yan from Zurarah who has said the following: “One of the two Imam, ‘Alayhim al-Salam, about the urine of edible animals that pollutes clothes, expressed dislike. I said, ‘It is from an edible animal.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is true but Allah has not made it for eating.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/162)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #10.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine of Animals and Their Dung
Hadith #10.arabicText: 10ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبِي الأعَزِّ النَّخَّاسِ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) إِنِّي أُعَالِجُ الدَّوَابَّ فَرُبَّمَا خَرَجْتُ بِاللَّيْلِ وَقَدْ بَالَتْ وَرَاثَتْ فَيَضْرِبُ أَحَدُهَا بِرِجْلِهِ أَوْ يَدِهِ فَيَنْضِحُ عَلَى ثِيَابِي فَأُصْبِحُ فَأَرَى أَثَرَهُ فِيهِ فَقَالَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ.
Hadith #10.englishText: 10. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Ali ibn al-Hakam from abu al-‘Aziz al-Nakhkhas who has said the following: “I once said to abu ‘Abd Allah , ‘I deal with animals. Some times I go out during the night, and animals may have urinated and dunged and they spread it with their legs which pollutes my clothes; and in the morning I find the marks.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘You are not required to do anything.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/163)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Dogs Touching Clothes, Body and So On
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدٍ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ إِذَا مَسَّ ثَوْبَكَ الْكَلْبُ فَإِنْ كَانَ يَابِساً فَانْضَحْهُ وَإِنْ كَانَ رَطْباً فَاغْسِلْهُ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz from Muhammad from whom he has mentioned who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘If a dog pollutes your clothes, and if it is dry, just pour water on your clothes; but if it is wet, then wash them clean.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/168)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Dogs Touching Clothes, Body and So On
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ هَلْ يَحِلُّ أَنْ يَمَسَّ الثَّعْلَبَ وَالأرْنَبَ أَوْ شَيْئاً مِنَ السِّبَاعِ حَيّاً أَوْ مَيِّتاً قَالَ لاَ يَضُرُّهُ وَلَكِنْ يَغْسِلُ يَدَهُ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus from certain persons of his people who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , if it is permissible to touch a fox, jackal or such other beasts dead or alive. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful but he must wash his hand.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/170)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Dogs Touching Clothes, Body and So On
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ ابْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنْ رَجُلٍ يَقَعُ ثَوْبُهُ عَلَى جَسَدِ الْمَيِّتِ قَالَ إِنْ كَانَ غُسِّلَ فَلاَ تَغْسِلْ مَا أَصَابَ ثَوْبَكَ مِنْهُ وَإِنْ كَانَ لَمْ يُغَسَّلْ فَاغْسِلْ مَا أَصَابَ ثَوْبَكَ مِنْهُ يَعْنِي إِذَا بَرَدَ الْمَيِّتُ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from ibn Ri’ab from Ibrahim ibn al-Maymun who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about a man whose clothes fall on a dead body. He (the Imam) said, ‘If the dead body is given Ghusl (bath), then it is not necessary to wash such clothes, but if it is not given Ghusl (bath) yet, one must wash such clothes - and that is, when the dead body has become cold.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/170)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Tayammum
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ التَّيَمُّمِ فَتَلاَ هَذِهِ الآيَةَ وَالسَّارِقُ وَالسَّارِقَةُ فَاقْطَعُوا أَيْدِيَهُما وَقَالَ فَاغْسِلُوا وُجُوهَكُمْ وَأَيْدِيَكُمْ إِلَى الْمَرافِقِ قَالَ فَامْسَحْ عَلَى كَفَّيْكَ مِنْ حَيْثُ مَوْضِعِ الْقَطْعِ وَقَالَ وَما كانَ رَبُّكَ نَسِيًّا.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from certain persons of our people who has said the following: “Abu ’Abd Allah , was once asked about Tayammum. He (the Imam) read this verse of the Holy Quran: ‘You must cut off the hands of male and female thieves.’ (5:38) He (the Imam) mentioned this verse of the Holy Quran. ‘Wash your faces and hands upto (from) your elbows’ (5:6) and said, ‘Wipe on (the back of that part of) your palms which must be cut in case of theft and your Lord is not to forget.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/173)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Tayammum
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْكُوفِيِّ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنْ غِيَاثِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) لاَ وُضُوءَ مِنْ مُوطَإٍ قَالَ النَّوْفَلِيُّ يَعْنِي مَا تَطَأُ عَلَيْهِ بِرِجْلِكَ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from al-Husayn ibn Ali al-Kufiy from al-Nawfaliy from Ghiyath ibn Ibrahim who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said that ’Amir al-Mu’minin , has said, ‘Wudu’ is not valid from the place you walk on.’ Al-Nawfaliy has said, ‘It means the place on which one steps.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/174)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #6.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Tayammum
Hadith #6.arabicText: 6ـ الْحَسَنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ الْعَلَوِيُّ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ جُمْهُورٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْعَظِيمِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الله الْحَسَنِيِّ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ الْعُرَنِيِّ عَنْ غِيَاثِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ نَهَى أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) أَنْ يَتَيَمَّمَ الرَّجُلُ بِتُرَابٍ مِنْ أَثَرِ الطَّرِيقِ.
Hadith #6.englishText: 6. Al-Hassan ibn Ali al-‘Alawiy has narrated from Sahl ibn Jumhur from ‘Abd al-‘Azim ibn ‘Abd Allah al-Hassaniy from al-Hassan ibn al-Husayn al-‘Uraniy from Ghiyath ibn Ibrahim who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘’Amir al-Mu’minin , has prohibited that a man take Tayammum with the soil of the road.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/175)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One’s Experiencing Carnal Relations and Having Only Ice
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بَشِيرٍ عَمَّنْ رَوَاهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَصَابَتْهُ الْجَنَابَةُ فِي لَيْلَةٍ بَارِدَةٍ يَخَافُ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ التَّلَفَ إِنِ اغْتَسَلَ قَالَ يَتَيَمَّمُ وَيُصَلِّي فَإِذَا أَمِنَ الْبَرْدَ اغْتَسَلَ وَأَعَادَ الصَّلاَةَ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from al-Husayn from Ja‘far ibn Bashir from those whom he has mentioned who has said the following: “I once asked abu ’Abd Allah , about the case of one who experiences sexual relation during a cold night and is afraid for his life due to Ghusl (bath) because of cold. He (the Imam) said, ‘One must take Tayammum to perform Salah (prayer) and when safe from cold, take Ghusl (bath) and perform such Salah (prayer) again.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/185)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Bandages, Injuries, One’s Suffering from Smallpox and or Experiencing Carnal Relations
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ بَكْرِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ وَابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْغِفَارِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْجَعْفَرِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ إِنَّ النَّبِيَّ (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) ذُكِرَ لَهُ أَنَّ رَجُلاً أَصَابَتْهُ جَنَابَةٌ عَلَى جُرْحٍ كَانَ بِهِ فَأُمِرَ بِالْغُسْلِ فَاغْتَسَلَ فَكُزَّ فَمَاتَ فَقَالَ رَسُولُ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) قَتَلُوهُ قَتَلَهُمُ الله إِنَّمَا كَانَ دَوَاءُ الْعِيِّ السُّؤَالَ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from Bakr ibn Salih and ibn Faddal from ‘Abd Allah ibn Ibrahim al-Ghifariy from Ja‘far ibn Ibrahim al-Ja‘fariy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said that once the case of a man on whose body there was a wound and had experienced sexual relation was mentioned before the Holy prophet and that they compelled him to take Ghusl (bath). It shriveled him with complications, which caused his death. The Messenger of Allah said, ‘They killed him, may Allah cause them to die. Only asking is medicine for ignorance.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/187)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Rare Ahadith about Wudu’
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ السِّنْدِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ صَبَّاحٍ الْحَذَّاءِ عَنْ أَبِي أُسَامَةَ قَالَ كُنْتُ عِنْدَ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فَسَأَلَهُ رَجُلٌ مِنَ الْمُغِيرِيَّةِ عَنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ مِنَ السُّنَنِ فَقَالَ مَا مِنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ يَحْتَاجُ إِلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ مِنْ وُلْدِ آدَمَ إِلاَّ وَقَدْ جَرَتْ فِيهِ مِنَ الله وَمِنْ رَسُولِهِ سُنَّةٌ عَرَفَهَا مَنْ عَرَفَهَا وَأَنْكَرَهَا مَنْ أَنْكَرَهَا فَقَالَ رَجُلٌ فَمَا السُّنَّةُ فِي دُخُولِ الْخَلاَءِ قَالَ تَذْكُرُ الله وَتَتَعَوَّذُ بِالله مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ وَإِذَا فَرَغْتَ قُلْتَ الْحَمْدُ لله عَلَى مَا أَخْرَجَ مِنِّي مِنَ الأذَى فِي يُسْرٍ وَعَافِيَةٍ قَالَ الرَّجُلُ فَالإِنْسَانُ يَكُونُ عَلَى تِلْكَ الْحَالِ وَلاَ يَصْبِرُ حَتَّى يَنْظُرَ إِلَى مَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُ قَالَ إِنَّهُ لَيْسَ فِي الأرْضِ آدَمِيٌّ إِلاَّ وَمَعَهُ مَلَكَانِ مُوَكَّلاَنِ بِهِ فَإِذَا كَانَ عَلَى تِلْكَ الْحَالِ ثَنَيَا بِرَقَبَتِهِ ثُمَّ قَالاَ يَا ابْنَ آدَمَ انْظُرْ إِلَى مَا كُنْتَ تَكْدَحُ لَهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا إِلَى مَا هُوَ صَائِرٌ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Salih ibn al-Sindiy from Ja‘far ibn Bashir from Sabah al-Hadhdh’a from abu ‘Usamah who has said the following: “Once I was in the presence of abu ‘Abd Allah , when a man of the followers of al- Mughirah asked him about matters of tradition (the Sunnah). The Imam replied, ‘There a tradition is set about everything that a son of Adam may need from Allah and His Messenger. There are those who have recognized such traditions and there are those who have rejected them.’ The man then asked, ‘What is the tradition about using the restroom?’ The Imam replied, ‘Speak of Allah and seek protection with Allah against Satan, the one condemned to be stoned. When you finish using a restroom you should say this. “All praise belongs to Allah who has relieved me of the discomfort with ease and good health.’” The man then asked, ‘Should one say such expressions in such a condition before looking back at what has come out?’ The Imam replied, ‘To every man on earth there are two angels assigned. When he is in such a condition, they bend his neck down saying, “O son of Adam, look down to the thing for which you have been struggling, into what kind of thing it has turned.’””

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/189)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Rare Ahadith about Wudu’
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ جَرَّاحٍ الْحَذَّاءِ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) مَنْ تَوَضَّأَ لِلْمَغْرِبِ كَانَ وُضُوؤُهُ ذَلِكَ كَفَّارَةً لِمَا مَضَى مِنْ ذُنُوبِهِ فِي نَهَارِهِ مَا خَلاَ الْكَبَائِرَ وَمَنْ تَوَضَّأَ لِصَلاَةِ الصُّبْحِ كَانَ وُضُوؤُهُ ذَلِكَ كَفَّارَةً لِمَا مَضَى مِنْ ذُنُوبِهِ فِي لَيْلَتِهِ إِلاَّ الْكَبَائِرَ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Amr ibn ‘Uthman from Jarrah al-Hadhdha’ from Sama‘ah ibn Mehran who has said the following. “Abu al-Hassan, Musa , has said, ‘If one takes Wudu’ for Maghrib Salah (prayer), this Wudu’ is expiation for the sins committed during the day that has just passed, except the major sins. If one takes Wudu’ for morning Salah (prayer), this Wudu’ is expiation for the sins committed during the night that has just passed, except the major sins.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/190)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #9.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Rare Ahadith about Wudu’
Hadith #9.arabicText: 9ـ أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الأشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ صَبَّاحٍ الْحَذَّاءِ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ كُنْتُ عِنْدَ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فَصَلَّى الظُّهْرَ وَالْعَصْرَ بَيْنَ يَدَيَّ وَجَلَسْتُ عِنْدَهُ حَتَّى حَضَرَتِ الْمَغْرِبُ فَدَعَا بِوَضُوءٍ فَتَوَضَّأَ لِلصَّلاَةِ ثُمَّ قَالَ لِي تَوَضَّأْ فَقُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ أَنَا عَلَى وُضُوئِي فَقَالَ وَإِنْ كُنْتَ عَلَى وُضُوءٍ إِنَّ مَنْ تَوَضَّأَ لِلْمَغْرِبِ كَانَ وُضُوؤُهُ ذَلِكَ كَفَّارَةً لِمَا مَضَى مِنْ ذُنُوبِهِ فِي يَوْمِهِ إِلاَّ الْكَبَائِرَ وَمَنْ تَوَضَّأَ لِلصُّبْحِ كَانَ وُضُوؤُهُ ذَلِكَ كَفَّارَةً لِمَا مَضَى مِنْ ذُنُوبِهِ فِي لَيْلَتِهِ إِلاَّ الْكَبَائِرَ.
Hadith #9.englishText: 9. Abu Ali al-Ash’ariy has narrated from certain persons of our people from ’Isma‘il ibn Mehran from Sabbah al-ffadhdha’ from Sama‘ah who has said the following: “I once was in the presence of abu al-Hassan , and he (the Imam) performed al-Dhuhr and al-‘Asr Salah (prayer) before me. I remained in his presence until al-Maghrib. He (the Imam) asked for Wudu’ (water) and he took Wudu’ for al-Maghrib Salah (prayer), then said to me, ‘You need to take Wudu’. 5 I said, ‘I pray to Allah to keep my soul in service for your cause, my Wudu’ is still valid.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘Even so you should take Wudu’; to those who take Wudu’ for al-Maghrib it serves as expiation for the sins that they may have done during that day except the major sins. Taking Wudu’ in the morning serves as expiation for the sins that one had committed during the night before except the major sins.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/198)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #10.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Rare Ahadith about Wudu’
Hadith #10.arabicText: 10ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى وَأَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ عَنْ سَعْدَانَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ الطُّهْرُ عَلَى الطُّهْرِ عَشْرُ حَسَنَاتٍ.
Hadith #10.englishText: 10. Muhammad ibn Yahya and Ahmad ibn Idris have narrated from Ahmad ibn Ishaq from Sa‘dan from certain persons of his people who have said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘For having al-Tuhr (cleansing) over al-Tuhr one receives a reward for ten good deeds.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/199)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #13.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Rare Ahadith about Wudu’
Hadith #13.arabicText: 13ـ أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الأشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْوَهَّابِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ الْجُعْفِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَمَّنْ مَسَّ عَظْمَ الْمَيِّتِ قَالَ إِذَا كَانَ سَنَةٌ فَلَيْسَ بِهِ بَأْسٌ.
Hadith #13.englishText: 13. Abu Ali al-Ash’ariy has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan from ‘Abd al-Wahhab from Muhammad ibn abu Hamzah from Hisham ibn Salim from ’Isma‘il al-Ju’fiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about touching the bones of a dead person. He (the Imam) said, ‘If it is after one year, it is not harmful.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/200)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Minimum and Maximum Duration of Hayd
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَشْيَمَ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنْ أَدْنَى مَا يَكُونُ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ فَقَالَ ثَلاَثَةٌ وَأَكْثَرُهُ عَشَرَةٌ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Ali ibn Ahmad ibn ‘Ushaym from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn abu Nasr who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan , about the minimum and maximum period of time of Hayd (menses). He (the Imam) said, ‘It is three days and its maximum is not more than ten days.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/204)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Minimum and Maximum Duration of Hayd
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مَرَّارٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ بَعْضِ رِجَالِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ أَدْنَى الطُّهْرِ عَشَرَةُ أَيَّامٍ وَذَلِكَ أَنَّ الْمَرْأَةَ أَوَّلَ مَا تَحِيضُ رُبَّمَا كَانَتْ كَثِيرَةَ الدَّمِ فَيَكُونُ حَيْضُهَا عَشَرَةَ أَيَّامٍ فَلاَ تَزَالُ كُلَّمَا كَبِرَتْ نَقَصَتْ حَتَّى تَرْجِعَ إِلَى ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ فَإِذَا رَجَعَتْ إِلَى ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ ارْتَفَعَ حَيْضُهَا وَلاَ يَكُونُ أَقَلَّ مِنْ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ فَإِذَا رَأَتِ الْمَرْأَةُ الدَّمَ فِي أَيَّامِ حَيْضِهَا تَرَكَتِ الصَّلاَةَ فَإِنِ اسْتَمَرَّ بِهَا الدَّمُ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ فَهِيَ حَائِضٌ وَإِنِ انْقَطَعَ الدَّمُ بَعْدَ مَا رَأَتْهُ يَوْماً أَوْ يَوْمَيْنِ اغْتَسَلَتْ وَصَلَّتْ وَانْتَظَرَتْ مِنْ يَوْمَ رَأَتِ الدَّمَ إِلَى عَشَرَةِ أَيَّامٍ فَإِنْ رَأَتْ فِي تِلْكَ الْعَشَرَةِ أَيَّامٍ مِنْ يَوْمَ رَأَتِ الدَّمَ يَوْماً أَوْ يَوْمَيْنِ حَتَّى يَتِمَّ لَهَا ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ فَذَلِكَ الَّذِي رَأَتْهُ فِي أَوَّلِ الأمْرِ مَعَ هَذَا الَّذِي رَأَتْهُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ فِي الْعَشَرَةِ فَهُوَ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ وَإِنْ مَرَّ بِهَا مِنْ يَوْمَ رَأَتِ الدَّمَ عَشَرَةُ أَيَّامٍ وَلَمْ تَرَ الدَّمَ فَذَلِكَ الْيَوْمُ وَالْيَوْمَانِ الَّذِي رَأَتْهُ لَمْ يَكُنْ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ إِنَّمَا كَانَ مِنْ عِلَّةٍ إِمَّا مِنْ قَرْحَةٍ فِي جَوْفِهَا وَإِمَّا مِنَ الْجَوْفِ فَعَلَيْهَا أَنْ تُعِيدَ الصَّلاَةَ تِلْكَ الْيَوْمَيْنِ الَّتِي تَرَكَتْهَا لأَنَّهَا لَمْ تَكُنْ حَائِضاً فَيَجِبُ أَنْ تَقْضِيَ مَا تَرَكَتْ مِنَ الصَّلاَةِ فِي الْيَوْمِ وَالْيَوْمَيْنِ وَإِنْ تَمَّ لَهَا ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ فَهُوَ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ وَهُوَ أَدْنَى الْحَيْضِ وَلَمْ يَجِبْ عَلَيْهَا الْقَضَاءُ وَلاَ يَكُونُ الطُّهْرُ أَقَلَّ مِنْ عَشَرَةِ أَيَّامٍ فَإِذَا حَاضَتِ الْمَرْأَةُ وَكَانَ حَيْضُهَا خَمْسَةَ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ انْقَطَعَ الدَّمُ اغْتَسَلَتْ وَصَلَّتْ فَإِنْ رَأَتْ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ الدَّمَ وَلَمْ يَتِمَّ لَهَا مِنْ يَوْمَ طَهُرَتْ عَشَرَةُ أَيَّامٍ فَذَلِكَ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ تَدَعُ الصَّلاَةَ وَإِنْ رَأَتِ الدَّمَ مِنْ أَوَّلِ مَا رَأَتِ الثَّانِيَ الَّذِي رَأَتْهُ تَمَامَ الْعَشَرَةِ أَيَّامٍ وَدَامَ عَلَيْهَا عَدَّتْ مِنْ أَوَّلِ مَا رَأَتِ الدَّمَ الأوَّلَ وَالثَّانِيَ عَشَرَةَ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ هِيَ مُسْتَحَاضَةٌ تَعْمَلُ مَا تَعْمَلُهُ الْمُسْتَحَاضَةُ وَقَالَ كُلُّ مَا رَأَتِ الْمَرْأَةُ فِي أَيَّامِ حَيْضِهَا مِنْ صُفْرَةٍ أَوْ حُمْرَةٍ فَهُوَ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ وَكُلُّ مَا رَأَتْهُ بَعْدَ أَيَّامِ حَيْضِهَا فَلَيْسَ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ’Isma‘il ibn Marrar from Yunus from certain persons of his people who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘The minimum duration of Hayd (menses) free period is ten days. This is because when a woman experiences Hayd (menses) it is of a greater amount and it takes ten days. It continues and as time passes and she grows older, the duration of her Hayd (menses) reduces to three days. In this condition it does not go higher and it is not less than three days.  “During her experiencing Hayd (menses) within the date of her Hayd (menses) she must stop performing Salah (prayer). If blood discharge continues for three days it counts as her period of Hayd (menses); but if blood discharge stops within a day or two, she must take Ghusl (bath) and perform her Salah (prayer). She then waits for ten days from the first day blood discharge had started. If she experiences blood discharge within that period of ten days for one or two days to complete three days, then what she had experienced before along with this one within ten days all are of her Hayd (menses). If however, for ten days after the first day she experienced blood discharge she does not experience any blood discharge, then one or two days of blood discharge is not of Hayd (menses). Such discharge can happen because of her internal problems, such as an injury or from internal problems. She must redo her Salah (prayer) missed during such one or two days in which she had stopped performing Salah (prayer). If blood discharge continues for three days, it then is Hayd (menses), which is the minimum duration of Hayd (menses). It is not necessary to perform Salah (prayer) as remedy for those missed during experiencing menses. The duration of the period free of menses is not less than ten days. If she experiences blood discharge for five days then blood discharge stops, she must take Ghusl (bath) and perform her Salah (prayer). If she experiences blood discharge after this and before ten days from theday blood discharge had stopped this as well is of her menses, and during such time she stops performing her Salah (prayer). If she experiences blood discharge which begins from the end of ten days that she had already experienced and it continues for several more days above the first ten days and the second discharge it (that which is above ten days) is of Istihadah (irregular menses) during which she follows the rules about Istihadah (irregular menses).’ He (the Imam) said, ‘Blood discharge, during her established period of menses, of yellow or red color is of menses and whatever discharge takes place after the duration of her menses is not of Hayd (menses).’”

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Women’s Experiencing Hayd After or Before Their Date of Hayd
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ إِذَا كَانَتْ أَيَّامُ الْمَرْأَةِ عَشَرَةَ أَيَّامٍ لَمْ تَسْتَظْهِرْ وَإِذَا كَانَتْ أَقَلَّ اسْتَظْهَرَتْ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from those who narrated to him who have said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘If normal duration of a woman’s blood discharge due to Hayd (menses) is ten days, she does not need to perform an examination but if it is less, she must perform an examination.’”

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Examining if Hayd (menses) has Ended or Not
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مَرَّارٍ وَغَيْرِهِ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَمَّنْ حَدَّثَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سُئِلَ عَنِ امْرَأَةٍ انْقَطَعَ عَنْهَا الدَّمُ فَلاَ تَدْرِي أَ طَهُرَتْ أَمْ لاَ قَالَ تَقُومُ قَائِماً وَتُلْزِقُ بَطْنَهَا بِحَائِطٍ وَتَسْتَدْخِلُ قُطْنَةً بَيْضَاءَ وَتَرْفَعُ رِجْلَهَا الْيُمْنَى فَإِنْ خَرَجَ عَلَى رَأْسِ الْقُطْنَةِ مِثْلَ رَأْسِ الذُّبَابِ دَمٌ عَبِيطٌ لَمْ تَطْهُرْ وَإِنْ لَمْ يَخْرُجْ فَقَدْ طَهُرَتْ تَغْتَسِلُ وَتُصَلِّي.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ’Isma‘il ibn Marrar and others from Yunus from those whom he has mentioned, has said the following: “Abu ’Abd Allah , was asked about the case of a woman who experiences her blood discharge to have stopped but does not know if she is Hayd-free or not. He (the Imam) said, ’She must stand up with her belly leaned against a wall, place a piece of white cotton in her urethra and raise her right leg. Thereafter she examines the piece of cotton. If there is thick dark color blood, even of the size of the head of a fly, on the tip of the piece of cotton, her Hayd (menses) has not stopped; and if there is no blood on the tip of cotton, she must take Ghusl (bath) and perform Salah (prayer).’”

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Taking Ghusl (bath) Because of Hayd and the Kind of Water Needed
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ مُثَنًّى الْحَنَّاطِ عَنْ حَسَنٍ الصَّيْقَلِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ الطَّامِثُ تَغْتَسِلُ بِتِسْعَةِ أَرْطَالٍ مِنْ مَاءٍ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn abu Nasr from Muthanna’ al-Hannat from Hasan al-Sayqal who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘A woman for her Ghusl (bath) due to Hayd (menses) must use nine Artal of water.” (One Ritl is about 449.28gms).

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/215)

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Women Find Blood after Sexual Relation
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مَرَّارٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) الْمَرْأَةُ تَرَى الدَّمَ وَهِيَ جُنُبٌ أَ تَغْتَسِلُ مِنَ الْجَنَابَةِ أَمْ غُسْلُ الْجَنَابَةِ وَالْحَيْضِ فَقَالَ قَدْ أَتَاهَا مَا هُوَ أَعْظَمُ مِنْ ذَلِكَ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ’Isma‘il ibn Marrar from Yunus from Sa‘id ibn Yasar who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about the case of a woman who experiences blood discharge because of Hayd (menses) when she has had sexual relation if she needs Ghusl (bath) because of sexual relation or Ghusl (bath) because of the sexual relation and Hayd (menses). He (the Imam) said, ‘She has experienced something bigger than that (sexual relation).”

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Comprehensive Instructions About Hayd (menses) and Istihadah (irregular menses)
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ غَيْرِ وَاحِدٍ سَأَلُوا أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الْحَائِضِ وَالسُّنَّةِ فِي وَقْتِهِ فَقَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) سَنَّ فِي الْحَائِضِ ثَلاَثَ سُنَنٍ بَيَّنَ فِيهَا كُلَّ مُشْكِلٍ لِمَنْ سَمِعَهَا وَفَهِمَهَا حَتَّى لاَ يَدَعَ لأَحَدٍ مَقَالاً فِيهِ بِالرَّأْيِ أَمَّا إِحْدَى السُّنَنِ فَالْحَائِضُ الَّتِي لَهَا أَيَّامٌ مَعْلُومَةٌ قَدْ أَحْصَتْهَا بِلاَ اخْتِلاَطٍ عَلَيْهَا ثُمَّ اسْتَحَاضَتْ وَاسْتَمَرَّ بِهَا الدَّمُ وَهِيَ فِي ذَلِكَ تَعْرِفُ أَيَّامَهَا وَمَبْلَغَ عَدَدِهَا فَإِنَّ امْرَأَةً يُقَالُ لَهَا فَاطِمَةُ بِنْتُ أَبِي حُبَيْشٍ اسْتَحَاضَتْ فَاسْتَمَرَّ بِهَا الدَّمُ فَأَتَتْ أُمَّ سَلَمَةَ فَسَأَلَتْ رَسُولَ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) عَنْ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ تَدَعُ الصَّلاَةَ قَدْرَ أَقْرَائِهَا أَوْ قَدْرَ حَيْضِهَا وَقَالَ إِنَّمَا هُوَ عِرْقٌ وَأَمَرَهَا أَنْ تَغْتَسِلَ وَتَسْتَثْفِرَ بِثَوْبٍ وَتُصَلِّيَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) هَذِهِ سُنَّةُ النَّبِيِّ (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) فِي الَّتِي تَعْرِفُ أَيَّامَ أَقْرَائِهَا لَمْ تَخْتَلِطْ عَلَيْهَا أَ لاَ تَرَى أَنَّهُ لَمْ يَسْأَلْهَا كَمْ يَوْمٍ هِيَ وَلَمْ يَقُلْ إِذَا زَادَتْ عَلَى كَذَا يَوْماً فَأَنْتِ مُسْتَحَاضَةٌ وَإِنَّمَا سَنَّ لَهَا أَيَّاماً مَعْلُومَةً مَا كَانَتْ مِنْ قَلِيلٍ أَوْ كَثِيرٍ بَعْدَ أَنْ تَعْرِفَهَا وَكَذَلِكَ أَفْتَى أَبِي (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) وَسُئِلَ عَنِ الْمُسْتَحَاضَةِ فَقَالَ إِنَّمَا ذَلِكَ عِرْقٌ غَابِرٌ أَوْ رَكْضَةٌ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ فَلْتَدَعِ الصَّلاَةَ أَيَّامَ أَقْرَائِهَا ثُمَّ تَغْتَسِلُ وَتَتَوَضَّأُ لِكُلِّ صَلاَةٍ قِيلَ وَإِنْ سَالَ قَالَ وَإِنْ سَالَ مِثْلَ الْمَثْعَبِ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) هَذَا تَفْسِيرُ حَدِيثِ رَسُولِ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) وَهُوَ مُوَافِقٌ لَهُ فَهَذِهِ سُنَّةُ الَّتِي تَعْرِفُ أَيَّامَ أَقْرَائِهَا لاَ وَقْتَ لَهَا إِلاَّ أَيَّامَهَا قَلَّتْ أَوْ كَثُرَتْ وَأَمَّا سُنَّةُ الَّتِي قَدْ كَانَتْ لَهَا أَيَّامٌ مُتَقَدِّمَةٌ ثُمَّ اخْتَلَطَ عَلَيْهَا مِنْ طُولِ الدَّمِ فَزَادَتْ وَنَقَصَتْ حَتَّى أَغْفَلَتْ عَدَدَهَا وَمَوْضِعَهَا مِنَ الشَّهْرِ فَإِنَّ سُنَّتَهَا غَيْرُ ذَلِكَ وَذَلِكَ أَنَّ فَاطِمَةَ بِنْتَ أَبِي حُبَيْشٍ أَتَتِ النَّبِيَّ (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) فَقَالَتْ إِنِّي أُسْتَحَاضُ فَلاَ أَطْهُرُ فَقَالَ النَّبِيُّ (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) لَيْسَ ذَلِكِ بِحَيْضٍ إِنَّمَا هُوَ عِرْقٌ فَإِذَا أَقْبَلَتِ الْحَيْضَةُ فَدَعِي الصَّلاَةَ وَإِذَا أَدْبَرَتْ فَاغْسِلِي عَنْكِ الدَّمَ وَصَلِّي وَكَانَتْ تَغْتَسِلُ فِي كُلِّ صَلاَةٍ وَكَانَتْ تَجْلِسُ فِي مِرْكَنٍ لأُخْتِهَا وَكَانَتْ صُفْرَةُ الدَّمِ تَعْلُو الْمَاءَ فَقَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) أَ مَا تَسْمَعُ رَسُولَ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) أَمَرَ هَذِهِ بِغَيْرِ مَا أَمَرَ بِهِ تِلْكَ أَ لاَ تَرَاهُ لَمْ يَقُلْ لَهَا دَعِي الصَّلاَةَ أَيَّامَ أَقْرَائِكِ وَلَكِنْ قَالَ لَهَا إِذَا أَقْبَلَتِ الْحَيْضَةُ فَدَعِي الصَّلاَةَ وَإِذَا أَدْبَرَتْ فَاغْتَسِلِي وَصَلِّي فَهَذَا يُبَيِّنُ أَنَّ هَذِهِ امْرَأَةٌ قَدِ اخْتَلَطَ عَلَيْهَا أَيَّامُهَا لَمْ تَعْرِفْ عَدَدَهَا وَلاَ وَقْتَهَا أَ لاَ تَسْمَعُهَا تَقُولُ إِنِّي أُسْتَحَاضُ فَلاَ أَطْهُرُ وَكَانَ أَبِي يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا اسْتُحِيضَتْ سَبْعَ سِنِينَ فَفِي أَقَلَّ مِنْ هَذَا تَكُونُ الرِّيبَةُ وَالاخْتِلاَطُ. فَلِهَذَا احْتَاجَتْ إِلَى أَنْ تَعْرِفَ إِقْبَالَ الدَّمِ مِنْ إِدْبَارِهِ وَتَغَيُّرَ لَوْنِهِ مِنَ السَّوَادِ إِلَى غَيْرِهِ وَذَلِكَ أَنَّ دَمَ الْحَيْضِ أَسْوَدُ يُعْرَفُ وَلَوْ كَانَتْ تَعْرِفُ أَيَّامَهَا مَا احْتَاجَتْ إِلَى مَعْرِفَةِ لَوْنِ الدَّمِ لأَنَّ السُّنَّةَ فِي الْحَيْضِ أَنْ تَكُونَ الصُّفْرَةُ وَالْكُدْرَةُ فَمَا فَوْقَهَا فِي أَيَّامِ الْحَيْضِ إِذَا عُرِفَتْ حَيْضاً كُلُّهُ إِنْ كَانَ الدَّمُ أَسْوَدَ أَوْ غَيْرَ ذَلِكَ فَهَذَا يُبَيِّنُ لَكَ أَنَّ قَلِيلَ الدَّمِ وَكَثِيرَهُ أَيَّامَ الْحَيْضِ حَيْضٌ كُلَّهُ إِذَا كَانَتِ الأيَّامُ مَعْلُومَةً فَإِذَا جَهِلَتِ الأيَّامَ وَعَدَدَهَا احْتَاجَتْ إِلَى النَّظَرِ حِينَئِذٍ إِلَى إِقْبَالِ الدَّمِ وَإِدْبَارِهِ وَتَغَيُّرِ لَوْنِهِ ثُمَّ تَدَعُ الصَّلاَةَ عَلَى قَدْرِ ذَلِكَ وَلاَ أَرَى النَّبِيَّ (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) قَالَ اجْلِسِي كَذَا وَكَذَا يَوْماً فَمَا زَادَتْ فَأَنْتِ مُسْتَحَاضَةٌ كَمَا لَمْ تُؤْمَرِ الأولَى بِذَلِكَ وَكَذَلِكَ أَبِي (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) أَفْتَى فِي مِثْلِ هَذَا وَذَاكَ أَنَّ امْرَأَةً مِنْ أَهْلِنَا اسْتَحَاضَتْ فَسَأَلَتْ أَبِي (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنْ ذَلِكَ فَقَالَ إِذَا رَأَيْتِ الدَّمَ الْبَحْرَانِيَّ فَدَعِي الصَّلاَةَ وَإِذَا رَأَيْتِ الطُّهْرَ وَلَوْ سَاعَةً مِنْ نَهَارٍ فَاغْتَسِلِي وَصَلِّي قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) وَأَرَى جَوَابَ أَبِي (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) هَاهُنَا غَيْرَ جَوَابِهِ فِي الْمُسْتَحَاضَةِ الأولَى أَ لاَ تَرَى أَنَّهُ قَالَ تَدَعُ الصَّلاَةَ أَيَّامَ أَقْرَائِهَا لأَنَّهُ نَظَرَ إِلَى عَدَدِ الأيَّامِ وَقَالَ هَاهُنَا إِذَا رَأَتِ الدَّمَ الْبَحْرَانِيَّ فَلْتَدَعِ الصَّلاَةَ وَأَمَرَ هَاهُنَا أَنْ تَنْظُرَ إِلَى الدَّمِ إِذَا أَقْبَلَ وَأَدْبَرَ وَتَغَيَّرَ وَقَوْلُهُ الْبَحْرَانِيَّ شِبْهُ مَعْنَى قَوْلِ النَّبِيِّ (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) إِنَّ دَمَ الْحَيْضِ أَسْوَدُ يُعْرَفُ وَإِنَّمَا سَمَّاهُ أَبِي بَحْرَانِيّاً لِكَثْرَتِهِ وَلَوْنِهِ فَهَذَا سُنَّةُ النَّبِيِّ (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) فِي الَّتِي اخْتَلَطَ عَلَيْهَا أَيَّامُهَا حَتَّى لاَ تَعْرِفَهَا وَإِنَّمَا تَعْرِفُهَا بِالدَّمِ مَا كَانَ مِنْ قَلِيلِ الأيَّامِ وَكَثِيرِهِ قَالَ وَأَمَّا السُّنَّةُ الثَّالِثَةُ فَهِيَ الَّتِي لَيْسَ لَهَا أَيَّامٌ مُتَقَدِّمَةٌ وَلَمْ تَرَ الدَّمَ قَطُّ وَرَأَتْ أَوَّلَ مَا أَدْرَكَتْ وَاسْتَمَرَّ بِهَا فَإِنَّ سُنَّةَ هَذِهِ غَيْرُ سُنَّةِ الأولَى وَالثَّانِيَةِ وَذَلِكَ أَنَّ امْرَأَةً يُقَالُ لَهَا حَمْنَةُ بِنْتُ جَحْشٍ أَتَتْ رَسُولَ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) فَقَالَتْ إِنِّي اسْتُحِضْتُ حَيْضَةً شَدِيدَةً فَقَالَ لَهَا احْتَشِي كُرْسُفاً فَقَالَتْ إِنَّهُ أَشَدُّ مِنْ ذَلِكَ إِنِّي أَثُجُّهُ ثَجّاً فَقَالَ تَلَجَّمِي وَتَحَيَّضِي فِي كُلِّ شَهْرٍ فِي عِلْمِ الله سِتَّةَ أَيَّامٍ أَوْ سَبْعَةً ثُمَّ اغْتَسِلِي غُسْلاً وَصُومِي ثَلاَثَةً وَعِشْرِينَ يَوْماً أَوْ أَرْبَعَةً وَعِشْرِينَ وَاغْتَسِلِي لِلْفَجْرِ غُسْلاً وَأَخِّرِي الظُّهْرَ وَعَجِّلِي الْعَصْرَ وَاغْتَسِلِي غُسْلاً وَأَخِّرِي الْمَغْرِبَ وَعَجِّلِي الْعِشَاءَ وَاغْتَسِلِي غُسْلاً قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فَأَرَاهُ قَدْ سَنَّ فِي هَذِهِ غَيْرَ مَا سَنَّ فِي الأولَى وَالثَّانِيَةِ وَذَلِكَ لأَنَّ أَمْرَهَا مُخَالِفٌ لأَمْرِ هَاتَيْكَ أَ لاَ تَرَى أَنَّ أَيَّامَهَا لَوْ كَانَتْ أَقَلَّ مِنْ سَبْعٍ وَكَانَتْ خَمْساً أَوْ أَقَلَّ مِنْ ذَلِكَ مَا قَالَ لَهَا تَحَيَّضِي سَبْعاً فَيَكُونَ قَدْ أَمَرَهَا بِتَرْكِ الصَّلاَةِ أَيَّاماً وَهِيَ مُسْتَحَاضَةٌ غَيْرُ حَائِضٍ وَكَذَلِكَ لَوْ كَانَ حَيْضُهَا أَكْثَرَ مِنْ سَبْعٍ وَكَانَتْ أَيَّامُهَا عَشْراً أَوْ أَكْثَرَ لَمْ يَأْمُرْهَا بِالصَّلاَةِ وَهِيَ حَائِضٌ ثُمَّ مِمَّا يَزِيدُ هَذَا بَيَاناً قَوْلُهُ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) لَهَا تَحَيَّضِي وَلَيْسَ يَكُونُ التَّحَيُّضُ إِلاَّ لِلْمَرْأَةِ الَّتِي تُرِيدُ أَنْ تُكَلَّفَ مَا تَعْمَلُ الْحَائِضُ أَ لاَ تَرَاهُ لَمْ يَقُلْ لَهَا أَيَّاماً مَعْلُومَةً تَحَيَّضِي أَيَّامَ حَيْضِكِ وَمِمَّا يُبَيِّنُ هَذَا قَوْلُهُ لَهَا فِي عِلْمِ الله لأَنَّهُ قَدْ كَانَ لَهَا وَإِنْ كَانَتِ الأشْيَاءُ كُلُّهَا فِي عِلْمِ الله تَعَالَى وَهَذَا بَيِّنٌ وَاضِحٌ أَنَّ هَذِهِ لَمْ تَكُنْ لَهَا أَيَّامٌ قَبْلَ ذَلِكَ قَطُّ وَهَذِهِ سُنَّةُ الَّتِي اسْتَمَرَّ بِهَا الدَّمُ أَوَّلَ مَا تَرَاهُ أَقْصَى وَقْتِهَا سَبْعٌ وَأَقْصَى طُهْرِهَا ثَلاَثٌ وَعِشْرُونَ حَتَّى يَصِيرَ لَهَا أَيَّاماً مَعْلُومَةً فَتَنْتَقِلَ إِلَيْهَا فَجَمِيعُ حَالاَتِ الْمُسْتَحَاضَةِ تَدُورُ عَلَى هَذِهِ السُّنَنِ الثَّلاَثَةِ. لاَ تَكَادُ أَبَداً تَخْلُو مِنْ وَاحِدَةٍ مِنْهُنَّ إِنْ كَانَتْ لَهَا أَيَّامٌ مَعْلُومَةٌ مِنْ قَلِيلٍ أَوْ كَثِيرٍ فَهِيَ عَلَى أَيَّامِهَا وَخَلْقِهَا الَّذِي جَرَتْ عَلَيْهِ لَيْسَ فِيهِ عَدَدٌ مَعْلُومٌ مُوَقَّتٌ غَيْرُ أَيَّامِهَا فَإِنِ اخْتَلَطَتِ الأيَّامُ عَلَيْهَا وَتَقَدَّمَتْ وَتَأَخَّرَتْ وَتَغَيَّرَ عَلَيْهَا الدَّمُ أَلْوَاناً فَسُنَّتُهَا إِقْبَالُ الدَّمِ وَإِدْبَارُهُ وَتَغَيُّرُ حَالاَتِهِ وَإِنْ لَمْ تَكُنْ لَهَا أَيَّامٌ قَبْلَ ذَلِكَ وَاسْتَحَاضَتْ أَوَّلَ مَا رَأَتْ فَوَقْتُهَا سَبْعٌ وَطُهْرُهَا ثَلاَثٌ وَعِشْرُونَ فَإِنِ اسْتَمَرَّ بِهَا الدَّمُ أَشْهُراً فَعَلَتْ فِي كُلِّ شَهْرٍ كَمَا قَالَ لَهَا فَإِنِ انْقَطَعَ الدَّمُ فِي أَقَلَّ مِنْ سَبْعٍ أَوْ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ سَبْعٍ فَإِنَّهَا تَغْتَسِلُ سَاعَةً تَرَى الطُّهْرَ وَتُصَلِّي فَلاَ تَزَالُ كَذَلِكَ حَتَّى تَنْظُرَ مَا يَكُونُ فِي الشَّهْرِ الثَّانِي فَإِنِ انْقَطَعَ الدَّمُ لِوَقْتِهِ فِي الشَّهْرِ الأوَّلِ سَوَاءً حَتَّى تَوَالَى عَلَيْهَا حَيْضَتَانِ أَوْ ثَلاَثٌ فَقَدْ عُلِمَ الآنَ أَنَّ ذَلِكَ قَدْ صَارَ لَهَا وَقْتاً وَخَلْقاً مَعْرُوفاً تَعْمَلُ عَلَيْهِ وَتَدَعُ مَا سِوَاهُ وَتَكُونُ سُنَّتَهَا فِيمَا تَسْتَقْبِلُ إِنِ اسْتَحَاضَتْ قَدْ صَارَتْ سُنَّةً إِلَى أَنْ تُحْبَسَ أَقْرَاؤُهَا وَإِنَّمَا جُعِلَ الْوَقْتُ أَنْ تَوَالَى عَلَيْهَا حَيْضَتَانِ أَوْ ثَلاَثٌ لِقَوْلِ رَسُولِ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) لِلَّتِي تَعْرِفُ أَيَّامَهَا دَعِي الصَّلاَةَ أَيَّامَ أَقْرَائِكِ فَعَلِمْنَا أَنَّهُ لَمْ يَجْعَلِ الْقُرْءَ الْوَاحِدَ سُنَّةً لَهَا فَيَقُولَ دَعِي الصَّلاَةَ أَيَّامَ قُرْئِكِ وَلَكِنْ سَنَّ لَهَا الأقْرَاءَ وَأَدْنَاهُ حَيْضَتَانِ فَصَاعِداً وَإِذَا اخْتَلَطَ عَلَيْهَا أَيَّامُهَا وَزَادَتْ وَنَقَصَتْ حَتَّى لاَ تَقِفَ مِنْهَا عَلَى حَدٍّ وَلاَ مِنَ الدَّمِ عَلَى لَوْنٍ عَمِلَتْ بِإِقْبَالِ الدَّمِ وَإِدْبَارِهِ وَلَيْسَ لَهَا سُنَّةٌ غَيْرُ هَذَا لِقَوْلِ رَسُولِ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) إِذَا أَقْبَلَتِ الْحَيْضَةُ فَدَعِي الصَّلاَةَ وَإِذَا أَدْبَرَتْ فَاغْتَسِلِي وَلِقَوْلِهِ إِنَّ دَمَ الْحَيْضِ أَسْوَدُ يُعْرَفُ كَقَوْلِ أَبِي (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) إِذَا رَأَيْتِ الدَّمَ الْبَحْرَانِيَّ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَكُنِ الأمْرُ كَذَلِكَ وَلَكِنَّ الدَّمَ أَطْبَقَ عَلَيْهَا فَلَمْ تَزَلِ الاسْتِحَاضَةُ دَارَّةً وَكَانَ الدَّمُ عَلَى لَوْنٍ وَاحِدٍ وَحَالَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ فَسُنَّتُهَا السَّبْعُ وَالثَّلاَثُ وَالْعِشْرُونَ لأَنَّهَا قِصَّتُهَا كَقِصَّةِ حَمْنَةَ حِينَ قَالَتْ إِنِّي أَثُجُّهُ ثَجّاً.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa have narrated from Yunus from more than one person who have said the following: “They asked abu ’Abd Allah , about women experiencing Hayd (menses) and the tradition in his time.
